titleStmt.title: Tido Project Specific Customization of the Music Encoding Initiative Guidelines
titleStmt.author: Raffaele Viglianti
Zoltán Kőmíves
Alexander Erhard

div.head: Introduction
div.p: This document a minimal MEI customization in order to define a very basic subset of elements with appropriate restrictions for basic use cases. For general information about MEI, please refer to the MEI Guidelines. Each restriction is implemented using the TEI ODD specification language, and documented in the prose section of this ducument, including examples (what is valid) and counter-examples (what is invalid)
Section Specifications lists every element available in the customization and can be used as a technical reference.

div.head: Module Selection
div.p: This basic customization only adopts following modules:

div.head: Common Attributes
div.p: xml:id is mandatory on all elements.

n is mandatory on the following elements:
layer
staff
verse

div.head: Time signature
div.p: Time signature must be expressed in a meterSig child element of staffDef
To define a time signature, the customization uses unit and count on meterSig. They must occur together:
Attributes for encoding time signatures on scoreDef and staffDef are excluded from the schema.

div.head: Key signature
div.p: Key signature must be expressed in keySig elements placed as child elements of staffDef at this stage of development.
To define a key signature, this customization uses the pname, accid and mode attributes of keySig. pname and mode must occur together, accid is optional.
Attributes for encoding key signatures on scoreDef and staffDef are excluded from the schema.

div.head: Clefs
div.p: Clefs must be expressed using the clef element.
To define a clef, the customization uses shape and line, which must occur together.
Attributes for encoding clefs on scoreDef and staffDef are excluded from the schema.

div.head: Events
div.p: This section describes restrictions to timed events on staves, such as notes, rests. etc.

div.head: Notes
div.p: Notes must either have an octave and a pitch name or a loc attribute. Stem direction remains optional, but is recommended. Notes within chords must not express stem information and duration
This is a typical note:

div.head: Duration
div.p: From this schema the gestural duration attribute dur.ges is excluded. In addition to this restriction, the specification of the dur attribute on events is more tightly controlled than it is in mei_all, as described in the following sections.

div.head: Notes
div.p: Notes must always have a duration (dur) except when they are part of chords.

div.head: Rests and spaces
div.p: Rest and spaces must always have a duration (dur).

div.head: Chords
div.p: Duration on chords must be expressed on the chord element. The constituent note elements are not allowed to express duration.

list.item: Duration on both chord and notes are not allowed:

div.head: Control events
div.p:
Control events like dir, hairpin, dynam, etc. can be placed either directly above or below a single staff or in the middle between two staves. Placement above or below a staff is indicated by the place attribute,
placement between two staves is expressed by specifying the numbers of both staves in the staff attribute.
When the staff attribute has multiple values, place and layer are not allowed:

div.head: Hairpins
div.p: Start and end point of hairpins must be expressed using tstamp and tstamp2 respectively. startid and endid attributes are currently disabled on hairpins.

div.head: Slurs
div.p:
Start and end point of slurs can almost always be expressed using startid and endid attributes. The only exceptions are "partial" slurs, such as the ones at the boundary of ending elements. Such slurs need to be encoded using the tstamp or tstamp2 attributes. When the inclompete slur starts at the barline, @tstamp="0" is used, when the slur is incomplete at its end point, @tstamp2="0m+n" is applied (where n is the meter.count of the current measure plus one: 5 in 4/4, 3 in 2/4 etc. see
4.1.5 Timestamps and Durations of the MEI Guidelines'. Additionally, all partial slurs has to be supplied with a curvedir attribute indicating the direction of the slur (values: "above" or "below").

However, since tstamps are not always enough to describe start and end point of slurs, and it is simply impractical to assert in which situation which encoding is expected, no restrictions apply for using combinations of startid/endid and tstamp/tstamp2 to describe slur start and end points.
A typical slur:
A partial slur within a 2nd ending:

exemplum.p: A valid pedal element with local URI references in startid and endid
An invalid pedal element with local URI references lacking the hash sign in startid and endid
An invalid pedal element with absolute URI references in startid and endid

macroSpec.desc: A count of measures plus a beat location, i.e., [0-9]+m\+[0-9]+(\.?[0-9]*)?. The measure count is the number of barlines crossed by the event, while the beat location is a timestamp in the measure where the event ends. For example, dur="1m + 3" indicates that the event ends in the next measure on beat 3. The measure number must be in the range of 0 to the number of remaining measures and the beat number must be in the range from 0 to the numerator of the time signature plus 1. For example, for an event starting in the first measure of a piece containing 6 measures in 6/8, the measure number must be between 0 to 5 and the beat number must be within the range from 0 to 7, e.g., "4m+3". The customization makes the measure value mandatory and removes optional spaces.

classSpec.desc: Required attributes that express duration in musical terms.

attDef.desc: records the duration of a feature using the relative durational values provided by the data.DURATION datatype.

classSpec.desc: Required attributes that record a time stamp in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional beat part].

attDef.desc: encodes the onset time in terms of musical time, i.e., beats[.fractional_beat_part].

classSpec.desc: Required attributes that record a time stamp for the end of an event in terms of musical time.

attDef.desc: encodes the ending point of an event in terms of musical time, i.e., a count of measures plus a beat location.

constraintSpec.desc: Prohibit layer when staff has multiple values.

sch:assert.test: if (contains(@staff, ' ') and @layer) then false() else true()

sch:rule.sch:assert: @layer must be absent when @staff contains multiple values.

constraintSpec.desc: Prohibit place when staff has multiple values.

sch:assert.test: if (contains(@staff, ' ') and @place) then false() else true()

sch:rule.sch:assert: @place must be absent when @staff contains multiple values.

constraintSpec.desc: Requires that precisely one of startid or tstamp is defined

sch:rule.sch:assert: precisely one of @tstamp or @startid must be defined

constraintSpec.desc: Requires that precisely one of endid or tstamp2 is defined

sch:rule.sch:assert: precisely one of @tstamp2 or @endid must be defined

exemplum.p: A valid rest element containing the required dur attribute
An invalid rest element without the required dur attribute
A valid space element containing the required dur attribute
An invalid space element without the required dur attribute

constraintSpec.desc: Require either pname and oct or loc on a note.

sch:assert.test: if (not(@pname and @oct) and not(@loc)) then false() else true()

sch:rule.sch:assert: either @pname and @oct or @loc must be specified on a note.

exemplum.p: A valid note element containing pname, oct and dur attributes
A valid note element containing loc and dur attributes
An invalid note element without the required dur attribute
An invalid note element specifying pname but not oct
An invalid note element specifying oct but not pname

attDef.desc: captures the visual rendition and function of the hairpin; that is, whether it indicates an increase or a decrease in volume.

exemplum.p: A valid chord element

egXML.p: An invalid chord element without the required dur attribute
An invalid chord in which the dur attributes of the note elements don't match the chord element's dir
An invalid chord in which the dur attributes of the note elements don't match the chord element's dir
An invalid chord in which the dur attributes of the note elements don't match the chord element's dir

exemplum.p: An invalid chord in which the dur attributes of the note elements don't match the chord element's dir

egXML.p: An invalid chord in which the dur attributes of the note elements don't match the chord element's dir
An invalid chord in which the dur attributes of the note elements don't match the chord element's dir

constraintSpec.desc: Require dur on notes outside chords.

sch:assert.test: if (not(ancestor::mei:chord) and not(@dur)) then false() else true()

constraintSpec.desc: Forbid att.stemmed attributes on notes in chords.

sch:rule.sch:report: Stem attributes not permitted on notes within a chord.

constraintSpec.desc: Forbid notes within chords to specify duration

sch:rule.sch:report: @dur attribute not permitted on notes within a chord.

A valid chord element with a stem.dir attribute and child notes without stem.dir
An invalid chord element with child notes containing stem.dir attributes
An invalid chord element with child notes containing dur attribute

attDef.desc: provides a name or number designation for an element. While the value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token. Must be an integer.

exemplum.p: A valid layer element with a positive integer n value
An invalid layer element missing n
An invalid layer element with a non-integer n

attDef.desc: provides a name or number designation for an element. While the value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token. Must be an integer.

exemplum.p: A valid staff element with a positive integer n value
An invalid staff element missing n
An invalid staff element with a non-integer n
A valid slur with tstamp and tstamp2 attributes
A valid slur with startid and endid attributes
A valid slur with tstamp and endid attributes
A valid slur with startid and tstamp2 attributes
A valid slur with a single value in staff and a layer attribute
An invalid slur without an attribute for the end point
An invalid slur without an attribute for the start point

remarks.p: Historically, the term "slur" indicated two notes performed legato, while the term "phrase" was used for a "unified melodic idea". Nowadays, however, "slur" often has the same meaning as "phrase", since the visual rendition of the two concepts is the same. Generic MEI provides two distinct elements so that those users wishing to maintain a distinction for historical reasons may do so. This basic MEI customization does not maintain this distiction, and employs the more generic slur element.

exemplum.p: A valid hairpin with all required and optional attributes
A valid hairpin with two values in staff and no layer attribute
A valid hairpin with a single value in staff and multiple values in layer
An invalid hairpin missing the form attribute
An invalid hairpin using the endid attribute
An invalid hairpin using the startid attribute
An invalid hairpin missing the tstamp2 attribute
An invalid hairpin missing the tstamp attribute
An invalid hairpin with multiple values in staff and a layer attribute

remarks.p: The hairpin element is used for graphical, i.e., crescendo and diminuendo, dynamic markings. For instantaneous or continuous textual dynamics, such as 'p', 'mf', or 'cres. poco a poco', the dynam element should be used. As opposed to generic MEI, in this basic customization the start and end point of the hairpin is always encoded with tstamp, and tstamp2 attributes.

attDef.desc: provides a name or number designation for an element. While the value need not be unique, it is required to be a single token. Must be an integer.

exemplum.p: A valid staffDef containing all required attributes
A valid staffDef containing all required attributes and a clef child element
A valid staffDef containing all required attributes and a meterSig child element

sch:rule.sch:report: Time signature must be complete (both @count and @unit are required).

exemplum.p: A valid meterSig containing all required attributes
An invalid meterSig without the unit attribute

sch:rule.sch:report: Key signature must be complete (both @pname and @mode are required).

An invalid keySig without the mode attribute
A invalid keySig without the pname attribute

sch:rule.sch:assert: Pedal styles must be consistent between pedal down and pedal up.

attDef.desc: holds the staff location of the number.

macroSpec.desc: The following list of articulations mostly corresponds to symbols from the Western Musical Symbols portion of the Unicode Standard. The dot and stroke values may be used in cases where interpretation is difficult or undesirable.
